Package LoggerFrame

Provides all resources necessary for the bot's three-level logging system. When put to proper use, the logging system provided by this custom annotation-based framework is incredibly powerful and provides a single access point for logging on three layers: (1) Direct console output. (2) Text file output. (3) Log channel on the designated server. Furthermore, this framework provides combinations. Such that when an annotation is set for file output, console output also occurs. And when an annotation is set for log channel output, both file and console outputs also occur. This system makes it easy for the bot to have a direct, simple and verbose logging system.

How To Use:

Using the logger framework is very simple! Two lines of code are necessary. An example of these lines at work can be seen below. Above the method to be logged, you have to declare the annotation @Logger() and inside the parenthesis, you have to declare a logger policy from LoggerPolicy. Once you've done that, all you have to do is call the logger method from LoggerCore. 

     @Logger (LoggerPolicy.File)
     public void myMethod(int parameterOne, String parameterTwo) {
         //Other Code Here
         LoggerCore.log(new Object(){}.getClass().getEnclosingMethod(), true, -1L, "Log This Message!");
     }
Since:

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Loggable
    Serves as a standardization gateway for ConsoleLogger, DiscordLogger and FileLogger.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConsoleLogger  
    DiscordLogger  
    FileLogger  
    LoggerCore
    Provides a single access point for logging, regardless of LoggerPolicy.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    LoggerPolicy
    Defines which loggers should run.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    LoggerException
    The Logger Exception is the Logger Framework's way of responding to a variety of cases that may prevent proper logging from occurring.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Logger
    The key annotation required for determining which logger tier to use.
